title: Opole cuisine - Wikipedia
content: Opole cuisine is an umbrella term for all dishes with a specific regional identity belonging to the region of Opole. It is a subtype of Polish and German cuisine with many similarities to and signs of the influence of neighbouring cuisines. • Wodzionka - stale bread and fat with water or milk[15] • Harynki w cebulowej zołzie (herring in onion sauce) - lightly salted Baltic herring served with sweet-sour onion sauce; may be served with śmietana[16] • Leberwurst drobno mielony z Górek (liverwurst from Górki) - a liverwurst produced after pig slaughter, spiced with garlic and pepper[21] • Pierogi postne ze Starych Kolni (Lent pierogi from Stare Kolnie) - originating from the village of Stare Kolnie; resembling a mid-sized cake, stuffed with groat kasza and potato[24] • Biołe kluski - potato dumplings with a small depression in the centre[27] • Śląskie niebo - bacon with kluski and sauce, generally with vegetables[28]
